The **wand of magic missile** is a [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 Origin](#Origin)
- [6 Messages](#Messages)
- [7 Variants](#Variants)
- [8 References](#References)

## Generation

A [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") may receive a wand of magic missile as part of their starting inventory.

There is a 5% chance that a [randomly-generated wand](/wiki/Wand#Generation "Wand") within the dungeon and its branches will be a wand of magic missile. Monsters may generate with the wand as a random [offensive item](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item").

[Shopkeepers](/wiki/Shopkeeper "Shopkeeper") have a 1⁄4 chance of being generated with a wand of magic missile.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Description

[Zapping](/wiki/Zap "Zap") the wand in a given direction will fire a [ray](/wiki/Ray "Ray") of magic missiles that damages monsters in its path - unlike the [spell of magic missile](/wiki/Spell_of_magic_missile "Spell of magic missile"), the wand only deals 2d6 damage and does not scale with the user's level. The ray can [rebound](/wiki/Rebound "Rebound") off walls and monsters with [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"). [Magic resistance](/wiki/Magic_resistance "Magic resistance") negates this damage, as does reflection.

[Engraving](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving") with a wand of magic missile will give a unique [message](#Message), but does not [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") the wand.[\[2\]](#cite_note-doknown-2)

## Strategy

Wands of magic missile are the least effective [attack wand](/wiki/Attack_wand "Attack wand"), dealing only 2d6 damage and lacking useful secondary effects - they are best used liberally in the early game as a form of disposable [ranged attack](/wiki/Ranged_attack "Ranged attack") as it will soon be almost worthless. The wand's damage can be increased to a somewhat respectable 4d6 by bouncing the ray off a wall behind your target.

It is possible to use a wand of magic missile to engrave in the dust while [levitating](/wiki/Levitation "Levitation"). If you're already levitating and want to engrave [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth"), you can use this to save a charge from a more useful [wand of digging](/wiki/Wand_of_digging "Wand of digging"), [fire](/wiki/Wand_of_fire "Wand of fire") or [lightning](/wiki/Wand_of_lightning "Wand of lightning"), since engravings will not erode while you are levitating.

Arguably the best use of a wand of magic missile in the late game is to [throw](/wiki/Throw "Throw") it at an intelligent monster. They may elect to pick it up and use it over any more deadly innate attacks or ranged weaponry that they possess, and most late-game players will have [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"), rendering it harmless while damaging the zapping monster along with other monsters in the ray's path that are not resistant.

## History

The wand of magic missile has been present in the game since Hack 1.21, a variant of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack").

## Origin

The canonical [D\&D](/wiki/D%26D "D\&D") spell of *[Magic Missile](http://www.d20srd.org/srd/spells/magicMissile.htm)* was a stereotypically puny level one wizard spell that quickly became a staple of the wizard class, as it was effectively a homing attack with each bullet doing its own damage roll; this can easily rack up significant damage, short of the target having magic resistance. The magic missiles of *NetHack* lack this homing property.

In [Rogue](/wiki/Rogue_\(game\) "Rogue (game)"), a wand of magic missile did *1d4+1* damage unless a given monster saves vs. magic ("The missile vanishes in a puff of smoke");[\[3\]](#cite_note-3); this is a rough translation of the spell into the world of Rogue. In [Hack](/wiki/Hack "Hack"), it would always have the appearance of an aluminum wand and dealt *2d6* damage;[\[4\]](#cite_note-4)[\[5\]](#cite_note-5) the latter trait was carried over into *NetHack*.

## Messages

- The floor is riddled by bullet holes!

  You engraved on the floor with a wand of magic missile.[\[2\]](#cite_note-doknown-2)

## Variants

In several variants, engraving with a wand of magic missile will auto-identify it.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 678](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/makemon.c#L678)
2. ↑ [2.0](#cite_ref-doknown_2-0) [2.1](#cite_ref-doknown_2-1) [src/engrave.c in NetHack 3.6.7, line 712](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.7_Released/src/engrave.c#L712): *the case for WAN\_MAGIC\_MISSILE does not set doknown*
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) <http://rogue.rogueforge.net/vade-mecum/#glossary>
4. [↑](#cite_ref-4) [Hack 1.02 Files Part 1](http://homepages.cwi.nl/~aeb/games/hack/uni87a/part1.)
5. [↑](#cite_ref-5) [Hack 1.02 Files Part 9](http://homepages.cwi.nl/~aeb/games/hack/uni87a/part9.)
